summary: Tuition Classes app: includes student dashboard and teacher/admin panel. Pay Fees flow is shifting from a static UPI deep link toward Razorpay payment link, and the teacher/admin should be able to manage (change) the payment account/link and update the timetable themselves.
architectural_notes: Built with Flutter Material 3; app navigation uses Navigator with MaterialPageRoute between screens.
Uses url_launcher for external intents: UPI payment URI and WhatsApp wa.me link.
Current UI uses static/hardcoded content for notes, timetable, and announcements (no backend/persistence shown).
Pay Fees UPI deep link should support dynamic amount entry and use payee display name "Bansal Tution Classes" (and teacher UPI ID) rather than a fixed amount.
Payment method direction discussed: use Razorpay Payment Link instead of the old static UPI deep link; the link/account should be configurable by the teacher/admin.
Open decision: admin changes (payment settings, timetable) need a persistence strategy (local-only on one device vs online sync across devices).

existing_features.title: Build a React web app that mirrors the provided Flutter “Tuition Classes App” flow: a Login screen that leads to a Student Dashboard with navigation to Notes, Timetable, Announcements, Pay Fees, Contact Teacher, and Teacher Admin screens.

Implement the Login screen UI with two inputs (Name, Password) and a Login action that creates a simple local session (front-end state) and routes to the Student Dashboard. No third-party authentication is required.
Create the Student Dashboard page as a list of navigable tiles/cards with the following destinations: Notes, Timetable, Announcements, Pay Fees, Contact Teacher, Teacher Admin.
Implement the Notes screen showing a simple list of available notes items: “Class 8 Maths – PDF”, “Class 9 Science – PDF”, “Class 10 English – PDF”.
Implement the Timetable screen showing the weekly schedule lines: “Monday – Maths – 4:00 PM”, “Tuesday – Science – 5:00 PM”, “Wednesday – English – 4:30 PM”.
Implement the Announcements screen displaying: “Test on Friday” and “Fees due by 10th”.
Implement the Pay Fees screen with a button that opens the provided UPI deep link in a new browser tab/window: upi://pay?pa=yourupi@bank&pn=Tuition&am=500&cu=INR.
Implement the Contact Teacher screen with a button that opens the provided WhatsApp URL in a new tab/window: https://wa.me/919999999999.

Implement the Teacher Admin screen showing three admin options: “Upload Notes”, “Update Timetable”, “Post Announcement”. For this initial version, these can be non-functional items but must have clear placeholder interactions (e.g., open a modal or navigate to a stub form page).

Apply a coherent, distinctive education-themed visual design across all pages (colors, typography, spacing, and components), avoiding a blue/purple primary palette. Keep styling consistent and use the existing UI component library by composition (do not edit read-only UI component sources).
Update the Pay Fees screen to allow parents to enter a custom fee amount (not fixed) before initiating payment via UPI apps.
When generating the UPI payment deep link on the Pay Fees screen, set the UPI payee name (pn) to "Bansal Tution Classes" and set the amount (am) to the user-entered amount.
Add basic validation and user feedback on the Pay Fees screen so that payment cannot be initiated with an empty, zero, or invalid (non-numeric) amount.

Add an Admin UI screen for Payment Settings that lets the teacher/admin view and update the payment receiving account details (at minimum: UPI VPA/ID for `pa` and payee name for `pn`) and save them to the backend.

Update the Pay Fees screen to use the latest teacher-configured payment settings from the backend when generating the UPI deep link, instead of hardcoding `pa=yourupi@bank` and `pn=Bansal Tution Classes`.
Add an Admin Timetable Editor screen that allows the teacher/admin to add, edit, and remove timetable entries (day, subject, time) and save them to the backend.
Update the Timetable screen to render timetable data fetched from the backend (teacher-managed) instead of the current hardcoded `schedule` array.

new_feature_requests.summary: Login screen (name + password) and navigation to home dashboard
Student dashboard with menu navigation to Notes, Timetable, Announcements, Pay Fees, Contact Teacher, and Teacher Admin screens
Notes screen listing available class notes (e.g., PDFs)
Timetable screen showing weekly class schedule
Pay Fees screen launching UPI payment intent (deep link)
Contact Teacher screen launching WhatsApp chat link
Teacher Admin screen with options to upload notes, update timetable, and post announcements
Update Pay Fees: pay via UPI apps directly to teacher account; set payee name to "Bansal Tution Classes" and allow parents to enter a custom fee amount (not fixed) before launching UPI intent
Teacher/Admin can update payment settings (change/add their own payment account details, e.g., Razorpay payment link) used by the Pay Fees screen
Teacher/Admin can create/update the timetable from within the app (timetable editor) rather than using only hardcoded schedule content
Persist teacher-managed payment settings in the Motoko backend so the teacher/admin can add or change the payment receiving account details used by the Pay Fees screen.
Persist a teacher-managed timetable in the Motoko backend so the teacher/admin can adjust the timetable from within the app and students see the updated timetable.
